title: how to learn Flask
content:
Learn Flask – A Beginner's Guide

🔹 What is Flask?

Flask is a lightweight and flexible web framework written in Python. It's designed to get you up and running quickly, with the ability to scale up to complex applications.

🔹 Why Choose Flask?

  • 🌟 Simple and minimal core
  • 🔌 Easily extensible with plugins
  • 📦 Built-in development server and debugger
  • 📚 Huge community and great documentation

🔹 Getting Started

  1. Install Flask using pip:
    pip install Flask
  2. Create a basic app:
 from flask import Flask app = Flask(__name__) @app.route('/') def home(): return 'Hello, Flask!' if __name__ == '__main__': app.run(debug=True)

🔹 Key Concepts to Learn

  • Routing with @app.route()
  • Templates using Jinja2
  • Request and response objects
  • Working with forms and user input
  • Connecting to a database (like SQLite or PostgreSQL)

🔹 Helpful Resources

  • Official Flask Documentation
  • Real Python Flask Tutorials
  • Flask on GitHub

🎯 Tip: Practice by building a small project like a blog, a to-do app, or a notes manager using Flask.

Happy Coding! 🚀
